official-title.#text:
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a tax credit for expenses for household and
			 elder care services necessary for gainful employment.

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

header.#text: Expenses for household and elder care services necessary for gainful employment

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended
			 by adding at the end the following new section:
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Subpart A of part IV of subchapter A of

external-xref.#tail: of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

header.#text: Expenses for household and elder care services necessary for gainful employment

text.#text:
In the case of an individual for which there are 1 or more qualifying individuals (as defined in
			 subsection (b)(1)) with respect to such individual, there shall be allowed
			 as a credit against the tax imposed by this chapter for the taxable year
			 an amount equal to the applicable percentage of the employment-related
			 expenses (as defined in subsection (b)(2)) paid by such individual during
			 the taxable year.

term.#tail:
means 35 percent reduced (but not below 20 percent) by 1 percentage point for each $2,000 (or
			 fraction thereof) by which the taxpayer’s adjusted gross income for the
			 taxable year exceeds $15,000.

text.#text: The term
expenses for household services, and

expenses for the care of a qualifying individual, including expenses for respite care and hospice

term.#tail:
means amounts paid for the following expenses, but only if such expenses are incurred to enable
			 the taxpayer to be gainfully employed for any period for which there are 1
			 or more qualifying individuals with respect to the taxpayer:

text.#text: The term
a qualifying individual described in paragraph (1)(A), or

a qualifying individual (not described in paragraph (1)(A)) who regularly spends at least 8 hours
			 each day in the taxpayer’s household.

Employment-related expenses described in subparagraph (A) which are incurred for services outside
			 the taxpayer’s household shall be taken into account only if incurred for
			 the care of—

such center complies with all applicable laws and regulations of a State or unit of local
			 government, and
the requirements of subparagraph (B) are met.

Employment-related expenses described in subparagraph (A) which are incurred for services provided
			 outside the taxpayer’s household by a dependent care center (as defined in
			 subparagraph (D)) shall be taken into account only if—

provides care for more than six individuals (other than individuals who reside at the facility),
			 and

receives a fee, payment, or grant for providing services for any of the individuals (regardless of
			 whether such facility is operated for profit).
For purposes of this paragraph, the term

continuation-text.#text:
The amount determined under paragraph (1) or (2) (whichever is applicable) shall be reduced by the
			 aggregate amount excludable from gross income under

text.#text:
The amount of the employment-related expenses incurred during any taxable year which may be taken
			 into account under subsection (a) shall not exceed—
$3,000 if there is 1 qualifying individual with respect to the taxpayer for such taxable year, or

$6,000 if there are 2 or more qualifying individuals with respect to the taxpayer for such taxable
			 year.

Except as otherwise provided in this subsection, the amount of the employment-related expenses
			 incurred during any taxable year which may be taken into account under
			 subsection (a) shall not exceed—

in the case of an individual who is not married at the close of such year, such individual’s earned
			 income for such year, or

in the case of an individual who is married at the close of such year, the lesser of such
			 individual’s earned income or the earned income of his spouse for such
			 year.
For purposes of this section—

An individual shall not be treated as having the same principal place of abode of the taxpayer if
			 at any time during the taxable year of the taxpayer the relationship
			 between the individual and the taxpayer is in violation of local law.

If the taxpayer is married at the close of the taxable year, the credit shall be allowed under
			 subsection (a) only if the taxpayer and his spouse file a joint return for
			 the taxable year.

header.#text: Married couples must file joint return

text.#text:
An individual legally separated from his spouse under a decree of divorce or of separate
			 maintenance shall not be considered as married.
If—
an individual who is married and who files a separate return—

maintains as his home a household which constitutes for more than one-half of the taxable year the
			 principal place of abode of a qualifying individual, and
furnishes over half of the cost of maintaining such household during the taxable year, and

during the last 6 months of such taxable year such individual’s spouse is not a member of such
			 household, such individual shall not be considered as married.

No credit shall be allowed under subsection (a) for any amount paid by the taxpayer to an
			 individual—

(relating to deduction
			 for personal exemptions for dependents) is allowable either to the
			 taxpayer or his spouse, or

In the case of a failure to provide the information required under the preceding sentence, the
			 preceding sentence shall not apply if it is shown that the taxpayer
			 exercised due diligence in attempting to provide the information so

header.#text: Identifying information required with respect to service provider

text.#text: No credit shall be allowed under subsection (a) for any amount paid to any person unless—

the name, address, and taxpayer identification number of such person are included on the return
			 claiming the credit, or

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, the name and address of such person are included on the return
			 claiming the credit.

text.#text: if such person is an organization described in

No credit shall be allowed under this section with respect to any qualifying individual unless the
			 TIN of such individual is included on the return claiming the credit.

header.#text: Identifying information required with respect to qualifying individuals

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall prescribe such regulations as may be necessary to carry out the purposes of
			 this section.

text.#text: The table of

toc-entry.#text: Sec. 25E. Expenses for household and elder care services necessary for gainful employment.

text.#text:
The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the
			 enactment of this Act.
